newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Iraqi exports boost OPEC Dec output - MEES.
newsitem.headline: Iraqi exports boost OPEC Dec output - MEES.

text.p: OPEC's oil production climbed by a further 120,000 barrels per day in December to reach 26.16 million bpd compared to 26.04 million bpd in November, the Middle East Economic Survey reported on Monday.
"The OPEC increase was pretty much wholly attributable to the resumption of the flow of Iraqi oil exports to world markets in mid-December," it said.

MEES estimated that about eight million barrels of Iraqi crude were exported from the Mediterranean terminal of Ceyhan and Mina al-Bakr in the Gulf during the second half of December, "working out at an average of around 250,000 bpd for the month as a whole".
"This incremental supply brought about an increase in Iraqi production from 550,000 bpd in November and previous months to 800,000 bpd in December," it said.
A Reuter survey of oil analysts, OPEC delegates and officials found that OPEC wellhead crude oil production rose 360,000 bpd to 26.40 million bpd in December.
MEES said that in 1996 OPEC crude production posted "a healthy gain of 876,000 bpd, or 3.5 percent, to 25.646 million bpd as compared with 24.770 million bpd in 1995."
